Key Arguments: The submission compares the proposed legislation to historical instances where government narratives were enforced, such as during the times of Galileo and Copernicus.
It argues that the legislation would suppress truth by penalizing those who challenge the government-approved narrative, using the example of Covid-19 vaccines not preventing infection.
The submission suggests that the legislation is dangerous and likens it to an Orwellian control of information.
Main Themes: Concerns about government overreach and control of information
Notable Quotes: Bill 2023 cannot pass; it is as nefarious as it is Orwellian.
